name: Google Calendar Widget & Short Code
author: Casey Bisson

sections.description:
Allows you to display Google Calendar content in widgets or embed it in pages or posts.

Get your Google Calendar embed code and paste it into a post or page. When you save the post or page, WPgcal will convert the iframe into a shortcode that displays the calendar. Or, paste the embed code into the widget and put it into a sidebar.

For security reasons, this plugin does not allow users to post content in iframes and does not require that your site allow iframes in post content. It detects the Google Calendar iframe embed code, parses it, and rewrites it as a shortcode.
sections.installation: 1. Place the plugin folder in your wp-content/plugins/ directory and activate it.

short_description: Adds a widget and shortcode to display or embed Google Calendars in WordPress.
description:

For security reasons, this plugin does not allow users to post content in iframes and does not require that your site allow iframes in post content. It detects the Google Calendar iframe embed code, parses it, and rewrites it as a shortcode.
